document_data.name: Nap
document_data.Effects: When cast, this spell placed a targeted creature into an hour-long nap. The nap, despite being so short, rejuvenated the recipient as if they had a restful full night of sleep. The spell could only be cast once on a creature per eighteen hours. The spell could only function on a willing creature.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components, this spell required [[material component]]s, a feather, a piece of pillow ticking and a pebble. The pebble had to be in the pocket of the caster for seven consecutive nights.
document_data.History: This spell was inscribed within ''[[Wythyndle's Round Book]]'', one of the few [[holy book]]s of the [[Church of Milil]]. It could also be cast by the ''[[Scepter of Mystra]]'', a relic of the faith of [[Mystra]].{{cite book/Prayers from the Faithful|77-80}}
